headline.main: BOTTOM LINES ON FAT AND CHOLESTEROL

docs.lead_paragraph: SUB for ''Bottom Lines...'' DAILY (thursday) letters page To the Editor: The newspapers, television news and talk shows, and soon the magazines, are in the midst of a non-argument on whether eating an egg is the first step to perdition, not to mention arteriosclerosis, diabetes and myocardial infarction. The discussion, unfortunately, is circular, with basic agreement so clouded over that no one but an expert can penetrate to what is known rather than what is sloganed. The facts are:

docs.lead_paragraph: TO THE LIVING SECTION: Having conducted a workshop on the impact of divorce on children at the Columbia School of Social Work last fall, and as a part-time stepparent myself, I read with interest K.C. Cole's article (''The Travails of a Part-Time Stepparent,'' May 14). While I suspect you will get a bevy of positive responses from bewildered, anxious, irritated stepparents, I forward a dissenting note about what is yet another in a glut of media attention to an overworked topic. If you must assault us again with the travails of dealing with the ex-wife, the rejection of our cooking, and the agony of establishing relationships with the children - I suggest some fresh approach, and a less ''cutesy'' tone.
